modules.description: This module provides low-level functions to manually manage input and output buffers for streaming JSON decoding and encoding. It works directly with byte buffers, allowing precise control over data flow by specifying memory regions for reading and writing. Concrete use cases include integrating with custom IO systems or processing JSON data in constrained memory environments.

This module extends the JSON codec to handle whitespace and non-standard JavaScript comments during decoding and encoding. It works with the same JSON data model but adds support for comment and whitespace lexemes. Use it when parsing or generating JSON-like content that includes comments or requires preserving formatting, such as configuration files or code transformation tools.

This module supports decoding and encoding JSON streams through non-blocking, incremental operations, allowing partial processing of data without full in-memory representation. It works with a structured `json` type representing JSON values (null, booleans, numbers, strings, arrays, objects) and exposes lexeme and error types for precise control over parsing and serialization. It is particularly useful for handling large JSON files, real-time data streams, or non-standard JSON variants containing comments and custom whitespace handling via its `Uncut` module.
